title: addurls adds to the top of the dataset not curdir, even some times with './' prefix specified
body:
given this simple csv file
```
$> cat ../urls
URL,subj
https://girder.dandiarchive.org/api/v1/item/5e9f9588b5c9745bad9f58ff/download,001
```
we have tried a few scenarios and it seems that `addurls` creates files from the top of the dataset when invoked within a subdirectory - in my case subdir `4/` within /tmp/metasearch dataset where `urls` file is located in the top of it
```shell
$> datalad addurls --fast ../urls '{URL}' "{_url_filename}"                         
addurl(ok): /tmp/metasearch/sub-mouse-AAYYT_ses-20180420-sample-2_slice-20180420-slice-2_cell-20180420-sample-2.nwb (file) [to sub-mouse-AAYYT_ses-20180420-sample-2_slice-20180420-slice-2_cell-20180420-sample-2.nwb]
metadata(ok): /tmp/metasearch/sub-mouse-AAYYT_ses-20180420-sample-2_slice-20180420-slice-2_cell-20180420-sample-2.nwb (file)     
action summary:
  add (notneeded: 1)
  addurl (ok: 1)
  metadata (ok: 1)
  save (notneeded: 1)
```
whenever I expected it to be produced in the current directory.
Specifying `./` prefix seems to help
```shell
(git-annex)lena:/tmp/metasearch[master]4
$> datalad addurls --fast urls '{URL}' './{_url_filename}'
addurl(ok): /tmp/metasearch/4/sub-mouse-AAYYT_ses-20180420-sample-2_slice-20180420-slice-2_cell-20180420-sample-2.nwb (file) [to 4/sub-mouse-AAYYT_ses-20180420-sample-2_slice-20180420-slice-2_cell-20180420-sample-2.nwb]
save(ok): . (dataset)                         
action summary:
  addurl (ok: 1)
  save (ok: 1)
```
but fails if there is a subdataset to be created:
```shell
(git-annex)lena:/tmp/metasearch[master]4
$> datalad addurls --fast ../urls '{URL}' './{subj}//{_url_filename}'
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/metasearch/001                                                                       
create(ok): 001 (dataset)                                                                                                        
addurl(ok): /tmp/metasearch/001/sub-mouse-AAYYT_ses-20180420-sample-2_slice-20180420-slice-2_cell-20180420-sample-2.nwb (file) [to sub-mouse-AAYYT_ses-20180420-sample-2_slice-20180420-slice-2_cell-20180420-sample-2.nwb]
save(ok): 001 (dataset)                       
save(ok): . (dataset)
action summary:
  addurl (ok: 1)
  create (ok: 1)
```
where you can see that `001` was created at the top.
